meanings.definition: A person or thing that cancels or annuls something.
meanings.sent1: The canceller of the event made sure everyone knew it was postponed.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's eraser is a canceller for mistakes on the whiteboard.
meanings.sent3: The canceller of the party was the unexpected rainstorm.
meanings.sent4: Her apology acted as a canceller for the argument, restoring peace.
meanings.sent5: The canceller of the flight was the sudden engine failure.

meanings.definition: A device or mechanism used to cancel out noise or interference.
meanings.sent1: The noise-canceller headphones blocked out all the sounds around him.
meanings.sent2: The canceller on the microphone helped eliminate the feedback during the concert.
meanings.sent3: The canceller for the radio station was a magical button that silenced all ads.
meanings.sent4: The white noise machine acted as a canceller, creating a peaceful sleeping environment.
meanings.sent5: The canceller on the phone reduced the background noise during the call.

meanings.definition: A person who cancels or voids a contract or agreement.
meanings.sent1: The canceller of the deal saved the company from a bad partnership.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer acted as the canceller in the legal dispute, ending the contract.
meanings.sent3: The canceller of the wedding was the unexpected revelation of a secret.
meanings.sent4: The canceller of the subscription was the customer's decision to switch services.
meanings.sent5: The canceller of the reservation was the sudden change in travel plans.
